title: QUBA College of Engineering & Technology: Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Reviews, Placement
meta_description: QUBA College of Engineering & Technology Admission 2024 is open for various courses. QUBA College of Engineering & Technology Admission is based on national level entrance exam and merit basis. Check latest updates and news on QUBA College of Engineering & Technology Admission 2024, Cutoff, Courses, Fees, Reviews, Rankings, Placement and other details.

basic_info.name: QUBA College of Engineering & Technology FAQ’s

faqs.question: DoesQUBA College of Engineering & Technologyoffer any scholarships to students?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, the college offers scholarships to students on the basis of their academics. Apart from that, the College is trying best to make coordination with nationalized banks to offer education loan facility to students

faqs.question: What are the documents required to get admission atQUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
faqs.answer: Ans.Documents that are required during the admission process are Mark sheet of the qualifying exam, Transfer certificate from Last Education / College / University, Conduct Certificate, Community Certificate, Migration Certificate if Applicable, Physical Fitness Certificate, A Joint declaration by parent/guardian, Community Certificate and Any other document required by the university

faqs.question: Ques.Is there any committee for an anti-ragging act at QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
faqs.answer: AnsYes,QUBAhas an anti-ragging committee to take care of this. If anyone found involved in ragging activity then strict action would be taken against him/her. Anyone be it; parents, guardians, and students can file complaints of anti-ragging via telephone or email also.

faqs.question: How one can contact QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
faqs.answer: Ans.One can get in touch with the College at 0861-2383531 or can mail atprincipal.k2@jntua.ac.in. One can also visit the campus on the address given at the official website of the College for face to face discussion.

faqs.question: What are the placement activities at QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
faqs.answer: Ans.The College conducts different placement activities for the benefit of students such as personality development workshops arrangement, organize industrial visits, train candidates in interview techniques and group discussions, and so on.

Section.name: About QCET
Section.description:
QUBA College of Engineering & Technology was established in the year 2002 and is affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University. The College is also approved by AICTE and offers UG and PG courses in numerous specializations. Admission in the programs are based on merit and candidates can apply to this College offline/online.
Few facts are tabulated below about the College that candidates can check.
The College offers admission to B.Tech, M.Tech, MCA, and MBA courses under the graduation and postgraduation program. The information about these courses regarding specializations, duration, eligibility, and selection criteria are mentioned below:
Read More: QUBA College of Engineering & Technology Courses & Fees
QCET AP EAPCET Cutoff 2024 is out. The table given below shows the cutoff for Round 1.
The College offers admission to students on a merit-basis for both UG and PG courses. Candidates for courses like B.Tech are selected on the basis of marks obtained in the 10+2 examination while candidates for courses like M.Tech, MBA, and MCA are selected on the basis of marks obtained in Bachelor’s Degree.
Candidates can either apply to this College online/offline. Interested candidates can get the form from the College office or can download it from a website. The application fee of INR 200 is to be paid by the candidate. The final decision of admission will be taken by higher authorities or as per the rules of the College.
To cater to the needs of students an environment-friendly campus has been equipped with all the basic facilities. Some of them are mentioned below:
The College has hired well- trained and experienced faculty members for each department. All of the faculty members have vast-knowledge and hold Bachelor’s/ Master’s Degree in his/ her specialization area. Each department consists of either 1 head or HOD and the other faculty members are working at the following positions: -
Ques. Does QUBA College of Engineering & Technology offer any scholarships to students?
Ans. Yes, the college offers scholarships to students on the basis of their academics. Apart from that, the College is trying best to make coordination with nationalized banks to offer education loan facility to students
Ques. What are the documents required to get admission at QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
Ans. Documents that are required during the admission process are Mark sheet of the qualifying exam, Transfer certificate from Last Education / College / University, Conduct Certificate, Community Certificate, Migration Certificate if Applicable, Physical Fitness Certificate, A Joint declaration by parent/guardian, Community Certificate and Any other document required by the university
Ques. Is there any committee for an anti-ragging act at QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
Ans Yes, QUBA has an anti-ragging committee to take care of this. If anyone found involved in ragging activity then strict action would be taken against him/her. Anyone be it; parents, guardians, and students can file complaints of anti-ragging via telephone or email also.
Ques. How one can contact QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
Ans. One can get in touch with the College at 0861-2383531 or can mail at principal.k2@jntua.ac.in. One can also visit the campus on the address given at the official website of the College for face to face discussion.
Ques. What are the placement activities at QUBA College of Engineering & Technology?
Ans. The College conducts different placement activities for the benefit of students such as personality development workshops arrangement, organize industrial visits, train candidates in interview techniques and group discussions, and so on.
